oai_dc:dc.dc:title: WAVE MEASUREMENTS BY A PRESSURE TYPE WAVE GAUGE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bergan, P.O
Torum, A.
Tratteberg, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wave measurements
pressure gauge
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The paper deals with comparative measurements of irregular model waves by a pressure type wave gauge and a continuous wire wave gauge. For the depth and wave conditions used in the study it is concluded that the height of individual waves obtained by a pressure type gauge and using the first order wave theory may be in considerable error, while wave height distributions and wave spectra are fairly good estimated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 11 (1968): Proceedings of 11th Conference on Coastal Engineering, London, United Kingdom, 1968.; 3
